column4: problems with swap after moving to edgy.  it is saying invalid swap signature - know how i can fix this?
Did you format your swap when installing?
Basically, vol_id -u /dev/<yourswap>, then put the UUID into /etc/fstab
/dev/hda3: error open volume
sudo vol_id :)
yup.  thats what is in my fstab :-(
Output of "swapon -s"?
there is no output.  even as sudo ;)
Try to "sudo mount /dev/<yourswap>"... any luck with swapon after that?
mountpoint does not exist
Sounds like an error in your fstab... could you paste *only* the line containing your swap here?
fdisk -l shows this: /dev/hda3            3967        4425     3686917+  82  Linux swap / Solaris
fstab line is this:  UUID=55073e08-64a3-438b-b0f1-4cfeeea539e8 none swap sw 0 0
sudo vol_id -u /dev/hda3 ------> 55073e08-64a3-438b-b0f1-4cfeeea539e8
Mh... I don't see any error. :\
Maybe you should try to sudo mkswap /dev/hda3, then try again.
:D:D:D   cool.
now i wonder why the heck it needed that?
Do you use hibernate?
suspend.  all the time
laptop.  acpi screws it up?
Nah, hibernate changes the swap space signature... but not suspend.
ok.  i bet i used it once then....
